profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion June 26, 2009

change.item: Legacy finding aid created from Pro Cite.

did.unittitle: Harris-Oliphant Papers,

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Laurence Oliphant (1829-1888) was a British writer and traveller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Letters written by and to Harris and his associate, Laurence Oliphant. In addition to the correspondence, these papers include manuscripts of books, miscellaneous biographical materials, and photographs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 6 series:

list.item: Series IV: Lawton & Schneider's Notes and Research Files

custodhist.p: The collection was formed in part by the poet Edwin Markham, after whose death it passed to Prof. Herbert Schneider and George Lawton and was used in writing their biography of Harris and Oliphant, A PROPHET AND A PILGRIM.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Harris-Oliphant Papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Collections related by provenance: Harris-Oliphant Papers at English Dept. of Wagner College, Staten Island. This collection duplicates Columbia holdings in part.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Curator of Manuscripts/University Archivist, Rare Book and Manuscript Library (RBML). The RBML approves permission to publish that which it physically owns; the responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

Series II: Diaries and Transcriptions

scopecontent.p: This series comprises transcriptions of letters by various writers, diary entries by Thomas Lake Harris, dictations/sermons of Thomas Lake Harris, an epigram from Thomas Lake Harris, and a partial bibliography of Thomas Lake Harris works with table of contents.
